titleStmt.title: Charles by the grace of God, King of Great Britaine ... forsamekle as wee beeing resolved to proceed in the matters referred to us by the submissions concerning the few fearmes and few meales of erections, teynds of other mens lands ...
titleStmt.author: Scotland. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A11693 of text S2316 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 21979). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 6 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 1 1-bit group-IV TIFF page image.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: Charles by the grace of God, King of Great Britaine ... forsamekle as wee beeing resolved to proceed in the matters referred to us by the submissions concerning the few fearmes and few meales of erections, teynds of other mens lands ...
titleStmt.author: Scotland. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

notesStmt.note: Second pt. of title from text.
At head of title: God saue the King.
Date of imprint suggested by STC (2nd ed.).
"Giuen vnder our signet at Haly-rud-house the sixteene daye of Iulij and of our raigne the fourth yeare. 1628."
Reproduction of original in the Town House (Aberdeen, Scotland). Charter Room.
